English: How are things going?
Chinese: 還順利嗎？
Korean: …진행 상황은 어떤가?
German: Wie läuft es?

English:
I believe my assistant was in the middle of an
operation when I noticed the connection link drop.
Chinese:
目前我助手的通訊位址消失，
就代表他正在進行作戰行動吧？
Korean:
통신처가 소실된 걸 보아하니, 조수는
작전행동중인 것 같다만
German:
Mein Hilfsdetektiv war gerade mit etwas
beschäftigt, als die Verbindung abgebrochen ist.

English:
Yes. There's nothing out of the ordinary here.
Everything's still going according to plan.
Chinese:
是的……完全沒有引起騷動，
目前還算順利……
Korean:
네… 소동도 일어나지 않았고
아직은 순조로운 것 같아요…
German:
Ja. Hier gibt es nichts Ungewöhnliches.
Noch läuft alles nach Plan.

English:
Hmm.
Those are some impressive skills.
Chinese: 嗯，幹得漂亮。
Korean: 흐음, 꽤 솜씨가 좋군
German:
Hm.
Beeindruckendes Talent.

English: Yes. I was a bit surprised, myself.
Chinese: 嗯嗯……我也有點驚訝……
Korean: 예… 저도 조금, 놀랐어요…
German: Ja, ich war auch etwas überrascht.

English:
To see how adept [p] has gotten at using Digimon
programs.
Chinese: 沒想到[p]居然能將數碼寶貝程式運用自如……
Korean:
[p] 씨가, 이렇게까지 디지몬 프로그램을
잘 다루고 있다니…
German:
Wie problemlos [p] mittlerweile mit
Digimon-Programmen umgehen kann.

English: No. I'm talking about you, Yuuko Kamishiro.
Chinese: 不，這一切都要歸功於妳啊，神代悠子小姐。
Korean: 아니― 네 얘기다, 카미시로 유코 씨
German: Nein. Ich rede von dir, Yuuko Kamishiro.

English:
The way you arranged the tour of the office, and
the way you've been responding to everything.
You're quite good at thinking on your feet.
Chinese:
參觀公司的手續也好，
妳處理任何事情都又快又正確。
Korean:
사내 견학의 준비라고는 해도, 모든 일의 대응이
정확하고 재빠르군
German:
Wie du das mit der Führung arrangiert hast,
und wie du seither auf alles reagierst.
Du bist ein helles Köpfchen.

English:
I'd say you're an old hat at this sort of thing.
Just who are you, exactly?
Chinese:
看起來……非常地熟練。
妳到底是何方神聖？
Korean:
상당히 익숙한… 것처럼 보이는군
넌 대체, 누구지?
German:
Fast so, als wärst du schon ein alter Hase in
diesen Dingen. Wer bist du genau?

English: I don't know what to say...
Chinese: 就……就算妳這麼說……
Korean: 그, 그렇게 말씀하셔도…
German: Ich weiß nicht, was ich sagen soll ...

English:
I'm just... me.
I don't know who else I am supposed to be.
Chinese:
我……就是我……
其他什麼都不是。
Korean:
전… 저예요
다른 그 누구도 아니에요
German:
Ich bin ... ich.
Ich wüsste nicht, wer ich sonst sein sollte.

English: Hmm...
Korean: 흐음……
German: Hm ...

English: Huh?!
Chinese: 嗯？
German: Huch?!

English: Was there something else?
Chinese: 又怎麼了嗎？
Korean: 또, 뭔가 있으신가요?
German: War noch etwas?

English: Uh-oh! We've been made!
Chinese: 啊！這是……被擺了一道！
Korean: 호오…! 이거… 당했군
German: Auweia! Man hat uns erwischt!

English: Wh-What was that just now?
Chinese: ！？　剛、剛才那是……？
Korean: !? 바, 방금 그건…!?
German: W-Was war das denn gerade?

English:
We could be in trouble.
Seems our conversation is being eavesdropped on.
Chinese:
事情不好了，
我們的對話似乎被竊聽了。
Korean:
…위험한 상황이 될 것 같군
아무래도, 우리들의 대화가 도청되고 있는 것 같다
German:
Könnte Ärger bedeuten.
Da lauscht wohl jemand unserer Unterhaltung.

English: What?!
German: Was?!

English:
In all likelihood, someone has placed a wiretap
program on your Digivice in the real world.
Chinese:
可能是妳在現實世界中的Digivice
被安裝了竊聽程式。
Korean:
아마, 현실 세계의 네 디지바이스에
도청 프로그램이 설치되어 있는 거겠지
German:
Wahrscheinlich hat jemand deinem Digivice in
der echten Welt ein Wanzenprogramm verpasst.

English:
I should have noticed it sooner. It takes some
real skill to finagle this specific a frequency.
Chinese:
我應該早點發現……
這種手法相當巧妙，使用了「特殊」頻率。
Korean:
좀 더 빨리 눈치챘어야 했나…
특수한 주파수대를 사용한 꽤나 교묘한 "세공"이다
German:
Ich hätte es früher bemerken sollen. Exakt
diese Frequenz vorzutäuschen, erfordert viel
Geschick.

English: Hmph. Whoever's doing this knows their stuff.
Chinese: 哼……對手很行嘛！
Korean: 훗… 상대는 꽤나 수완가로군
German:
Hmpf. Wer es auch ist, die Person kennt sich
jedenfalls aus.

English: Eavesdropping? But that means...
Chinese: 竊、竊聽……怎麼會……
Korean: 도, 도청… 그, 그럴 수가……
German: Jemand lauscht? Aber das bedeutet ...

English:
Yeah. I hate to make this call, but you need to
pull out of there ASAP. Consider it a valiant
retreat of sorts.
Chinese:
嗯……雖然不太情願，但還是提早撤退吧！
這就是所謂撤退的勇氣。
Korean:
음… 바라던 바가 아니지만, 서둘러 물러나도록 하겠어
용기 있는 후퇴, 라는 거다
German:
Ja. Ich sage das nur ungern, aber ihr müsst da
schleunigst raus. Sieh es als eine Art
heldenhaften Rückzug.

English:
Slow and steady wins the race. This line of work
requires a patient and diligent disposition.
Chinese:
欲速則不達……這種作戰的基本精神，
就是不能急，要一步一步慢慢來。
Korean:
급하면 돌아서 가는 법… 이런 종류의 작전은
착실하고 초조해하지 않는걸 기본으로 삼아야 할 정신이다
German:
Die Schildkröte schlägt den Hasen.
In diesem Metier muss man geduldig und
sorgfältig sein.

English: But [p] is still inside!
Chinese: 可、可是那個人還在裡面……！
Korean: 하, 하지만, 아직 그 사람이 안에…!?
German: Aber [p] ist noch nicht zurück!

English:
Yes.
I doubt it'll be easy to get the 'abort mission'
order through.
Chinese:
嗯……
要通知他作戰中止似乎有難度。
Korean:
…음
작전의 중지를 전하는 건 어려울 것 같군
German:
Ja.
Es wird nicht einfach sein, den Rückzugsbefehl
durchzugeben.

English:
But [p] is my assistant,
and should be able to figure something out.
Chinese:
不過他是我的助手，
一定會自己想辦法的。
Korean:
뭘, 내 조수다
스스로 어떻게든 할 거다
German:
Aber als mein Hilfsdetektiv wird [p]
sich schon etwas einfallen lassen.

English: But that's--
Chinese: 怎、怎麼這樣～！？
Korean: 그, 그런―!?
German: Aber das ist ...

English:
You're not in a position to worry about anyone
else right now. Hurry up and get out of there.
Chinese:
妳沒有時間擔心別人，
妳也快點離開這裡吧！
Korean:
다른 사람 걱정을 할 때가 아니다
너도 급히 자리를 뜨도록
German:
Du solltest dir über andere gerade nicht den
Kopf zerbrechen. Beeil dich und verschwinde da.

English:
I'll wait for whatever caused my assistant's
little vanishing act to wear off.
Chinese: 我會繼續等，直到我助手的“透明人化”失效。
Korean: 난 조수의 "투명인간화" 효과가 사라지는 걸 기다리겠다
German:
Ich warte, bis der Hokuspokus Verschwindibus
meines Hilfsdetektivs wieder aufhört.

English:
On your way out, it should be possible to cover
your tracks and employ some misdirection from the
outside.
Chinese:
逃脫時，
從外面也有辦法消去足跡，矇混過去……
Korean:
탈출 시, 발자취를 없애거나 속이는 것 정도는
밖에서도 가능하겠지…
German:
Verwischen wir deine Spuren auf deinem Rückweg
und sorgen für Ablenkung von außen.

English:
It's too risky to keep this conversation going.
I'm going to cut the line.
Chinese:
總之，繼續對話下去的話會有危險……
我先切斷了。
Korean:
어쨌든, 이 이상 대화하는 건 위험하다
…이만 통신을 끊겠다
German:
Dieses Gespräch ist zu riskant.
Ich lege jetzt auf.
